alert.note: Alert for Tangipahoa (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:56PM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tangipahoa River Near Robert affecting Tangipahoa Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tangipahoa River near Robert. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 04/04/1960. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning around 830 AM CST.Wednesday afternoon at 300 PM CST.
